title.narrative: Start Fund Locally led and inclusive COVID-19 response in Kayin, Myanmar 4

description.narrative:
- PPE FOR QUARANTINE VOLUNTEERS: This project provide focused support in preparation against the spread of COVID-19 in rural and peri-urban border areas. This will involve PPE at community quarantine facilities and information management support based on the feedback received from the government/facility managers at Myawaddy and district medical officers in Kwakeriek, village administration and at risk communities across all the townships including Thandaunggyi and Baw Ga Lae (a sub-township of Hpaan). - CASH ASSISTANCE: The assistance would also include multi purpose cash transfers to meet the multiple needs around health, hygiene and food both with the returnees/families and other vulnerable groups. Markets in the area are still functional and communities could procure basic food items and medicines.
- KEY HEALTH MESSAGING: Further the initiative would be complimented by provision of information on COVID prevention and facilities in the identified townships. There is a need for funds for Covid-19 related awareness messaging which local organisations are not able to spread effectively. While community quarantine centres have been set up, they lack resources and effective monitoring of those in quarantine.

1.Community quarantine centres are prepared to deal with the existing population and potential influx of people both in border gates 2. Reduction in risk for populations and minimise the stigma around COVID-19 which allows people to self declare the symptomatic cases 3. Improved behaviour of people towards COVID-19 positive cases and enhanced solidarity
4. Women and men with disabilities are engaged, better protected and included in the response activities and provided support 5. Access to correct and trust worthy Covid1i information through verified and reliable platforms to enable people make informed decisions
6. Vulnerable households including people with disabilities have access to Cash to support their basic needs to deal with restrictions/lockdowns and suspension of businesses
